Submodules

utils.databricks_filesystem module

class utils.databricks_filesystem.DatabricksFileSystem[source]

Bases: object

This is a conceptual class representation of Databricks’ filesystem interaction using pandas.

Usage:

from utils.databricks_filesystem import DatabricksFileSystem

dbfs = DatabricksFileSystem() dbfs.create(dbfs_path=’/dbfs/FileStore/my_dataframe.xlsx’, df=my_dataframe) df = dbfs.read(dbfs_path=’/dbfs/FileStore/my_dataframe.xlsx’)

static create(dbfs_path: str, df: pandas.DataFrame)[source]

Writes a DataFrame to a specified path in Databricks’ filesystem.

Parameters:

  • dbfs_path (str) – The path in Databricks’ filesystem to write the DataFrame.

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – The DataFrame to write.

Usage:

dbfs.create(dbfs_path=’/dbfs/FileStore/my_dataframe.xlsx’, df=my_dataframe)

static delete(dbfs_path: str)[source]

Deletes a file from a specified path in Databricks’ filesystem.

Parameters:

dbfs_path (str) – The path in Databricks’ filesystem of the file to delete.

Usage:

dbfs.delete(dbfs_path=’/dbfs/FileStore/my_dataframe.xlsx’)

static read(dbfs_path: str)[source]

Reads a file from a specified path in Databricks’ filesystem into a DataFrame.

Parameters:

dbfs_path (str) – The path in Databricks’ filesystem from which to read the file.

Returns:

The DataFrame containing the file’s data.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

Usage:

df = dbfs.read(dbfs_path=’/dbfs/FileStore/my_dataframe.xlsx’)

static update(dbfs_path: str, df: pandas.DataFrame)[source]

Overwrites an existing file in Databricks’ filesystem with a DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • dbfs_path (str) – The path in Databricks’ filesystem of the file to overwrite.

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – The DataFrame to write.

Usage:

dbfs.update(dbfs_path=’/dbfs/FileStore/my_dataframe.xlsx’, df=my_updated_dataframe)

utils.logger module

class utils.logger.Logger(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: object

Logger is a class for application-level logging. It provides methods to write log messages to standard output. Log messages include timestamp, script name and line number, log level and the message itself.

This class follows Singleton pattern to avoid duplicate log messages.

Usage: from logger import Logger

logger = Logger(“MyScript”).get_logger() logger.info(“This is an info message”)

get_logger() → Logger[source]
Returns:

Returns the logger instance.

Return type:

logging.Logger

class utils.logger.Singleton[source]

Bases: type

Singleton is a metaclass for creating singleton classes. Singleton classes are classes that can have only one instance at any time. It means if you create an object and try to create another one, the same instance will be returned.

Usage: from logger import Singleton

class Logger(metaclass=Singleton):

…

utils.model_utils module

utils.model_utils.append_column_solution(df_optional, df_mandatory, df_zeros, df_semi_mandatory, portfolios, portfolios_semi_mandatory)[source]

Function that joins the portfolios of the optional projects and appends the mandatory and vpn zero projects, while adding some columns that improve the understanding of the results DataFrame. The returned df of this function is later stored as a table

Parameters:

  • df_optional (DataFrame) – DataFrame with the optional projects evaluated by the model

  • df_mandatory (DataFrame) – DataFrame with the mandatory projects

  • df_zeros (DataFrame) – DataFrame with the vpn zero projects

  • df_semi_mandatory (DataFrame) – DataFrame with the df_semi_mandatory projects

  • portfolios – list with the different portfolios generated by the model

  • portfolios_semi_mandatory – list with the different portfolios generated by the model for semi_mandatory

projects :type config: list

Return: DataFrame with all the projects and portfolios generated by the model :rtype DataFrame

utils.model_utils.calc_fitness_access_gas(access_gas, goal, coefficient)[source]

Method to calculate the fitness of access_gas used in a solution

Parameters:

  • access_gas (np.array) – array with the access_gas of projects for all years

  • goal (float) – parameter with the goal for access_gas

  • coefficient (float) – Parameter that gives weight to the fitness

Usage:

self.calc_fitness_access_gas(access_gas,20, 0.25)

Returns:

np.array: fitness of access_gas

:rtype np.array

  • coefficient (float) – weight applied to the fitness

utils.model_utils.calc_fitness_low_emissions(total_ebitda: array, total_low_ebitda: array, minimum, coefficient: float, goal=False)[source]

Method to calculate the fitness of low emissions used in a solution

Parameters:

  • total_low_ebitda (np.array) – array with the total sum of low emissions projects for all years

  • total_ebitda (np.array) – array with the total sum of all projects ebitda for all years

  • minimum (float) – minimum value present in the model config

  • coefficient (float) – Parameter that gives weight to the fitness

  • goal (bool) – Parameter that tells if we just want the goal or if we want the fitness

Usage:

self.penalize_low_emissions(ebidta, low_emission_ebidta, 0.25)

Returns:

np.array: fitness low emission

:rtype np.array

utils.model_utils.check_capex(mutant, df_projects, df_semi_mandatory, mandatory_capex, actives_off, config)[source]

Function to check capex restriction, in this function the array is passed by reference because of this it is modified here without the need of returning it

Args:

mutant: df_projects: df_semi_mandatory: mandatory_capex: actives_off: config:

Returns:

Parameters:

  • mutant (np.array) – np.array containing the portafolio to be checked

  • df_projects (DataFrame) – df containing projects

  • df_semi_mandatory (DataFrame) – df containing semi mandatory projects

  • mandatory_capex (np.array) – np.array containing the mandatory capex for each year

  • actives_off (np.array) – np.array actives with basic off

  • config (dictionary) – dictionary containing configs

Returns:

None

Parameters:

  • mutant (np.array) – np.array containing the portafolio to be checked

  • indexes_isa (np.array) – np.array containing index location of ISA projects

Returns:

None

utils.model_utils.check_length(df, config)[source]
utils.model_utils.filter_projects(df, zero_restriction, phase_restriction, be_restriction, config, params)[source]

Function to get different dataframes from the input data

Parameters:

  • df (Dictionary) – DataFrame with the input data

  • zero_restriction (bool) – bool that indicates if zero restriction is on or off

  • phase_restriction (bool) – bool that indicates if phase restriction is on or off

  • config (Dictionary) – Dictionary containing configs from excel and json

  • params (Dictionary) – Dictionary containing configs from BI

:return DataFrame: DataFrame with the projects to be evaluated DataFrame: DataFrame with the projects with vpn negative or zero DataFrame: DataFrame with the mandatory projects for every portfolio DataFrame: DataFrame with the semi mandatory projects for every portfolio

:rtype tuple(DataFrame, DataFrame, DataFrame, DataFrame)

utils.model_utils.generate_initial_population(sol_per_pop, num_genes, df, df_semi_mandatory, isa_index, mandatory_capex, config)[source]

Funcion that creates an initial population given the solutions per population, number of genes and the data. All the basic projects will be set to one, and the capex restriction is met from the start :param sol_per_pop: solutions per population :type df: int :param num_genes: number of genes :type df: int :param df: data containing projects :type df: DataFrame :param df_semi_mandatory: data containing semi_mandatory projects :type df_semi_mandatory: DataFrame :param isa_index: array containing index of ISA projects :type isa_index: np.array :param mandatory_capex: array containing mandatory capex :type mandatory_capex: np.array :param config: Dictionary containing configurations :type config: Dictionary

Returns:

np array containing the population

:rtype np.array

Function that gets downstream refineries attributes :param df_down: df containing info about refineries :type df_down: DataFrame :param initial: Tells if this is an initial run where down and mid are not considered or if it is a normal execution :type initial: bool :param config: Dictionary containing config of model :type config: Dictionary

Returns:

attributes of the refineries by year
